siteSettings.siteTagline: Nourishing community with dignity and care.

contact.address: Cranbourne Community Hub, 65-95 Berwick-Cranbourne Rd, Cranbourne VIC

donate.note: Donations of $2 or more are tax deductible. Receipts issued within 5 business days.

service.title: Weekly community dinners
service.description: Hot meals, fresh groceries, warm conversations and practical care. Everyone is welcome.
notes: No ID required – just come as you are.
Family friendly space with play corner.
Bring your own containers if you can.

volunteerForm.placeholderBody: Add your Tally.so form URL in the CMS to display it here.

footer.contactBody: We’re here to serve our Cranbourne neighbours with warmth and dignity.
footer.bottomNote: Built with care for the Cranbourne community.

seo.defaultDescription: Cranbourne Food Truck serves free, nutritious meals and wraparound support for our neighbours each week.

hero.headline: A welcoming meal for anyone who needs it
hero.subheadline: Our volunteer-powered food truck offers hot dinners, pantry staples and friendly faces every Tuesday and Thursday night.
hero.imageAlt: Community members gathered at the Cranbourne Food Truck

whatWeDo.title: What we do
whatWeDo.description: More than a meal – our team provides nourishment, connection and wraparound care for neighbours doing it tough.

cards.title: Hot, hearty meals
cards.description: Chef-prepared dinners, dessert and hot drinks served with dignity.

cards.title: Groceries to go
cards.description: Fresh produce, pantry staples and toiletries to take home.

cards.title: Care & connection
cards.description: Support workers and volunteers ready to listen and link you in.

impact.title: Community impact
impact.description: Live service data updates every few minutes from our Google Sheet.

items.quote: It’s not just dinner – it’s where I feel seen and supported.
items.name: Leah

items.quote: Volunteering here reminds me that small acts of kindness matter.
items.name: Jason

items.quote: My kids look forward to the truck nights – the team treats us like family.
items.name: Maree

seo.title: Home
seo.description: Discover how Cranbourne Food Truck serves free meals, groceries and care to our community each week.

fallbackLatestService.notes: Pop-up haircuts and health clinic onsite.

seo.title: Stats
seo.description: Live service numbers and dashboards from Cranbourne Food Truck.

story.title: Our story
story.body: Cranbourne Food Truck began in 2016 with one borrowed van and a handful of neighbours who believed no one in our suburb should eat dinner alone. Since then, we’ve cooked tens of thousands of meals and grown into a mobile hub for connection, health and dignity.

missionVision.title: Mission & vision
missionVision.mission: We serve nourishing food and wraparound care so that everyone in Cranbourne feels seen, supported and valued.
missionVision.vision: A connected community where neighbours look out for one another and everyone has what they need to thrive.

points.title: Hospitality
points.description: Creating warm, safe spaces with comforting meals served by friendly faces.

points.title: Dignity
points.description: Choice-driven support, free from judgement, celebrating each person’s strengths.

points.title: Collaboration
points.description: Working with local agencies, schools and churches to coordinate care.

partnerships.title: How we partner
partnerships.description: We collaborate with schools, businesses, service clubs and health providers to expand what we can offer guests.

futurePlans.title: What’s next
futurePlans.body: We are working toward expanding service nights, adding a mobile pantry van and launching a hospitality training pathway for young people.

seo.title: About us
seo.description: Meet the team, mission and story behind Cranbourne Food Truck.

donate.introBody: Every plate we serve is made possible by generous supporters. Donations fund fresh produce, pantry staples, volunteer training and the fuel that keeps our truck rolling.

seo.title: Donate
seo.description: Support Cranbourne Food Truck with a tax-deductible donation or secure online gift.

volunteer.introBody: We’re a crew of neighbours, chefs, drivers and friendly faces who believe everyone deserves a warm meal and a warm welcome. Share your details and we’ll be in touch about upcoming volunteer opportunities.

seo.title: Volunteer
seo.description: Register your interest to volunteer with Cranbourne Food Truck.

sponsors.introBody: We’re grateful for the businesses, councils, schools and service clubs who invest time, funding and expertise so Cranbourne families can access nourishing support.

seo.title: Sponsors & Partners
seo.description: Meet the community sponsors and partners who power Cranbourne Food Truck.

data.title: Privacy
data.description: Privacy statement for Cranbourne Food Truck guests, supporters and volunteers.

privacy.content:
## Privacy statement

This is a placeholder privacy statement. Update this page through the CMS with your organisation’s privacy policy, including how you collect, use and store personal information.

For questions please email [hello@cranbournefoodtruck.com](mailto:hello@cranbournefoodtruck.com).

data.title: Terms
data.description: Terms of use for Cranbourne Food Truck services and website.

terms.content:
## Terms of use

This is a placeholder terms of use page. Provide your service terms through the CMS, including participation expectations, disclaimers and any limitations of liability.

Contact us at [hello@cranbournefoodtruck.com](mailto:hello@cranbournefoodtruck.com) with any questions.

team.content: Amira connects guests with housing, health and employment services through trusted relationships.
Jane leads our volunteers and community partnerships, making sure every guest is welcomed with warmth.
Sam curates seasonal menus using donated produce and ensures every meal is both delicious and nourishing.

stories.content: A handful of neighbours, a loaned van and 40 home-cooked meals – that first chilly night sparked a movement of generosity. We have been serving ever since.
We expanded to two service nights this year, welcoming more than 7,000 guests and launching partnerships with local health providers for on-site clinics.

data.name: Brewed Awakenings Cafe
data.blurb: Donating barista-made coffee and training volunteers in hospitality.

data.name: Cranbourne Secondary College
data.blurb: Students prep produce each week and help host family activity stations.

data.name: City of Casey
data.blurb: Funding our fresh produce purchases and providing kitchen facilities.
